intro: Oocephalus halimifolius, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open woodlands and coastal dunes. Oocephalus halimifolius is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
